title: Timezone problem
text: Outlook for the iPhone is not properly calculating time zone changes. Iâ€™m in Arizona where we do not change time, and my meetings next week are showing off by 1 hour. Outlook on my Mac shows them properly.

title: Extremely confusing, poor design
text: This is the most confusing email app I have ever used. Nothing about how it organizes my inbox makes any sense. The tabs at the bottom are totally irrelevant/unhelpful, and the only two folders I have are â€œpriorityâ€ and â€œotherâ€ (which might as well be â€œrandomâ€ and â€œrandomâ€ because it just arbitrarily puts all incoming email in one or the other). I canâ€™t find my drafts or sent mail, and the search function is pretty much useless. To make matters worse, I have to use it for 2FA codes, but sometimes they donâ€™t pop up at all or take several seconds to appear, preventing me from logging in to my account on other devices. Itâ€™s astonishing how they even managed to make email this confusing and frustrating.

title: Off the Record
text: Donâ€™t tell Apple but i legit enjoy this app more than the native â€˜Mailâ€™ on my iPhone. i canâ€™t even elucidate as to why exactlyâ€¦ just more â€˜responsiveâ€™ ? better GUI ? i prefer the layout and design and fonts , perhaps ? who knows but i just feel happier using this than any other mail app ğŸ˜‚ so , to the developers of this genuine gem , i say: *bravo* . title: Needs a few basic integrationsâ€¦
text: Am I missing something? App installed on my iPad. Shows I can send emails to Microsoft To Do app. Cool. Helpful. Same app on my iPhone - no such integration. Iâ€™d really, really like to use and enjoy this app. But until it gets some integrations with even the most basic apps, (not even Microsoftâ€™s! ) itâ€™s just not effective for me.

title: Very good app but have 2 suggestions
text:
I have folders created for emails from specific ppl to land there, but when they do the app doesnt tell me i have new emails, so it says 0 in inbox but these new emails landed in the other folder and i dont know i have new emails there until i slide to see the folders from the left side. The other idea is to be able to navigate through the emails w/o having to go back to the list. In other words i open an email and then would like to go to the next email like in mail app. 
Other than that the app works well, its fast, and i live the schedule send feature.

title: Spam emails
text:
Rating lower due to the amount of spam emails that come through to my inbox on a daily basis. There really needs to be a way to filter these out. I have multiple gmail accounts that are able to move these types of emails to a different folder without my prompting. It gets frustrating to have to constantly clear these out of my focus inbox. 

Other than that the app functions as expected.

title: Good app with two staggering flaws
text:
1. Every 2-3 months, the app goes back to displaying a notification â€œopen outlook to view messageâ€ when I receive a new email. This is completely unacceptable when the only solution is to delete and redownload the app. 

2. No ability to schedule send emails from app. Have to use online version. How is something so simple missing from outlook.

title: Irritating!
text: Please fix the reply reply all options. I should not have to scroll all the to the end of the email or chain to reply. I would suggest a floating reply button.

title: A surprisingly good email client.
text:
Search is better than it was, and has strong integration with organization-wide Office and email. 

Nifty adoption of select mark down attributes for fast composing, and pretty good integration of voice for going through and responding to email when you donâ€™t feel like using the keyboard.

title: Update 4/5/24
text: Hello I updated my app today & now my email wonâ€™t load. I actually noticed it seems to be a reoccurring issue since I hadnâ€™t received email since Friday & when I logged in on the website I had several missed messages.

title: Mostly Good
text: Outlook on my iPhone is pretty useful except that i periodically cannot find emails I know are there. Also, the junk and blocking functions appear to be completely useless. I even get emails with the offer to unblock the blocked sender. This is EXTREMELY frustrating and will be the reason I dump this app at some point. It wastes my time and I really donâ€™t have the patience.

title: Search function is too random
text:
Very weak app - some really basic and important interfaces donâ€™t work well. 

For starters, itâ€™s very hard to search things in my emails. The app takes way too much liberty interpreting terms that are similar to my search terms. Doesnâ€™t allow me to add â€œâ€ or â€˜â€™ either to narrow down search to more precise terms or look for combinations of words. Also doesnâ€™t show me which email the term is found in, instead it randomly shows other emails from the thread that donâ€™t even contain those wordsâ€¦ 
The other thing that is really missing but should be such a basic function, is to be able to check the calendar while you compose an email. Now you need to exit the email youâ€™re writing, open the calendar and then exit the calendar  and go all the way back and find the draft email in the drafts folder. Thatâ€™s unnecessarily convoluted, isnâ€™t it?
